channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #190 - It's All About Numbers
item.description: Numbers, numbers, everything revolve around numbers. Last week not only had a Friday the 13th, but also saw the celebrations of Pi Day (which mostly revolve around making math jokes and eating pies). This edition of the PW doesn't lack in numerals either: amongst other things, Rex turns 1, Neil hangs 10 (places most likely to host your module repository) and Timm has fun with GPS coordinates. Enjoy! ~ `/anick
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Work for Uniregistry, building and maintaining Internet new Top Level Domains
item.description: Use Moose, DBIx::Class, Catalyst, AnyEvent and work in an dream office in Newport Beach office in California to Â build and maintain our registry platform and services for Internet new Top Level Domains (nTLDs). Send your CV to jobs@uniregistry.link

item.title: InsideSales.com - Pass our "Perl Challenge" & Win a $100 Amazon Gift Card
item.description: Our yummy Perl codebase handles millions of emails in production each week! We're growing like crazy, doubling in revenue and size annually. We want you to join our team in Utah. Pass our "Perl Challenge" to win a $100 Amazon gift card and an interview. Hires will receive a sizable signing bonus.

item.title: The Creator of Perl is Coming to Romania
item.description: Larry Wall will be a guest speaker for the 3rd anniversary of Cluj.pm. In other news, Cluj.pm is already 3 years old? Geeee, time sure flies...

item.title: Rex turns 1.0.0
item.description: The deployment and configuration management tool Rex reached v1.0.0.

item.title: Call for Venue for YAPC::Europe::2016
item.description: This year, it's all happening in Granada. But next year...? The call for venues is officially on and, if you desire to have YAPC be in your city, you have until May the 15th to send your letter of intent to the committee.

item.title: Perl in February
item.description: Karen recaps what has been going in the organizational world of Perl. Conferences are prepared, programs are readied, grants are evaluated. In short, business as usual (which, mind you, is an excellent thing).

item.title: How to add online code badges to your Perl projects
item.description: Badges are nifty. Want to add some to your GitHub README.md and your metaCPAN POD? Garu is going to show you how.

item.title: The top 10 hosts for CPAN repositories
item.description: Where do the repositories of CPAN modules live? Neil crunched the numbers and share the result. Spoiler alert: if GitHub goes down, it won't be pretty.

item.title: Dear Lazyblog
item.description: Want to have your stuff talked about at the German Linux Conference but won't be there? lichtkind might be the proxy you were looking for.

item.title: Why I donated to the Perl QA Hackathon
item.description: Camspi loves working with Perl. Ergo, he wants it to go on and flourish. Hence his patronage of the Perl QA Hackaton.

item.title: GPS and Perl
item.description: If you want to add some GPs functionality to your Raspberry Pi -- or anything else thats run Perl and has a GPS interface -- this article is for you.

item.title: Creating API-friendly CLI applications with parseable outputs
item.description: perlancar shows how Perinci::CmdLine can takes away the drudgery of creating tabular output for command-line tools.

item.title: Quickly Debug your Perl code at the command line
item.description: perl, the executable, comes with a vast panoply of command-line arguments. David covers here the most useful ones you absolutely need to know.

item.title: Writing XS Like a Pro - The INTERFACE Keyword
item.description: XS coders, gather 'round, for Nick Wellnhofer is about to reveal the secrets of the INTERFACE keyword.

item.title: 2015.10 FOSDEM Videos and Role Conflicts
item.description: What happened on the Perl6 front this week. Plus a nice bunch of Perl6 videos from FOSDEM.

item.title: Why is it hard to write a compiler for Perl6?
item.description: For everybody who ever asked the question, Moritz counts the ways.

item.title: CPAN great modules released last week
metacpan weekly report - ZMQ::FFI
stackoverflow perl report
Passing two arrays to a function
Moo and required attributes
item.description: ... and how to convince it to give a clear(er) error message.

item.title: How to download a Perl module from CPAN
item.description: Sometimes you might want to download and unzip a whole distribution without even installing it. There are a number of ways to do this.
